summary: The implementation successfully addresses all 10 requirements from the BuildRequest. The backend includes the PurchaseRequisition type with all required fields, CRUD operations with status filtering, and approval workflow methods. The frontend provides complete React Query hooks, form components for creating and editing requisitions, a table with status-based filtering and conditional actions, a detailed approval component with timeline, the main page with dialog-based creation, navigation integration with FileText icon (though specified as ClipboardList in implementation), and proper route registration. All components follow existing patterns for styling, validation, error handling, and status badges.

hallucinated_features.description: Migration module (backend/migration.mo) for handling data migration between old and new actor structures
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not mention implementing a migration module or handling upgrades from existing deployments. This appears to be infrastructure code beyond the specified requirements.

hallucinated_features.description: EditPurchaseRequisitionForm component with read-only fields for requestedBy and department
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-6 mentions 'Edit for Draft status' but does not specify a separate EditPurchaseRequisitionForm component or detail the edit functionality. The BuildRequest does not explicitly request this component, though it is a reasonable implementation detail for the edit action.
REQ-8 specifies only '/purchase-requisitions' route. REQ-7 describes the approval component but does not specify it should be on a separate detail page with its own route.
